到達目標: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following.
特記事項: この授業を履修するには、事前にレベル認定の申請が必要です。詳細は備考欄を確認してください。
関連科目:
None. 
Note: The field trip is optional and will not affect grades but is reccommended. Students can also go on their own if they can not come on the field trip day. The field trip day will be decided with the students on the first day and student sill have to pay their own way.  Please note again the field trip is optional.
授業の概要・背景: The Otsuka Museum of Art in Tokushima has recreated 1000 works of European art using their chemical process to print them on tiles that preserve the size, color, and design of the original artworks. We will look at the 25 most famous works of art and examine their location, history, artist, and concept. If students can not attend the optional field trip to the museum they are encouraged to go on their own or someday visit the original museums in Europe.
授業方法: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following.

第1回:
All 14 sessions are conducted Face to face
Course orientation.
Introduction to the Otsuka Museum of Art.
Introduction to the periods of art history.
第2回:
Ancient Times
Hall of Mysteries 
Tomb of Augurin
第3回:
Ancient Times
Venus Floating on a Seashell
Alexander Mosaic
第7回:
Mid-term journal evaluation.
Mid-term written test.
Choosing of final project topics.
第8回:
Renaissance
Girl with the Pearl Earring
Mona Lisa
第14回:
Field trip to the Otsuka Museum of Art. 
Make up tests or presentations can be arranged with the teacher by appointment.
Final course evaluations and feedback.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
各授業科目は、各学部・研究科の定めるディプロマ・ポリシー（DP）・カリキュラム・ポリシー（CP）に基づき、カリキュラム上に配置されています。
DP・CPを意識して本授業科目の学修を進めることで、各学部・研究科の期待する能力が養成されます。
各学部・研究科のDP、CPや教育課程表（授業科目一覧等）は、下記リンクこちらに掲載していますので学修計画の参考にしてください。
